title: How to Make Mango and Pineapple Sorbet

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
2 cups frozen mango chunks
1/2 cup pineapple juice.

steps.headline: Place the frozen mango chunks into the blender.
Blend to combine.
steps.description: If the sorbet is too runny, add more mango; if too thick, add more juice. If there is too much mango or juice eliminate some.

steps.headline: Place scoops straight into the serving dishes or ice cream cups.

methods.name: Mango and pineapple sorbet in a Wildside jar

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1 orange, peeled and cut in half
1 cup pineapple chunks
2 tablespoons sugar syrup or agave nectar
1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lime juice
2 cups ripe mango chunks.

steps.headline: Place the ingredients into a Wildside jar.
steps.description: Add them in the order above.

steps.headline: Secure the lid.
steps.description: Select the ice cream setting. When ready, serve.

methods.name: Mango and pineapple sorbet in a Vitamix

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1 cup frozen pineapple chunks
1 cup frozen mango chunks
1/2 cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk or dairy milk with a drop of vanilla extract.

steps.headline: Add all of the ingredients to the Vitamix.
Blend the ingredients together until smooth.
Scoop into dishes or dessert cups for serving.
steps.description: Sprinkle a little desiccated coconut on top for a garnish (optional).

steps.headline: Gather your ingredients.
steps.description:
You'll need:
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup granulated sugar
2 cups orange juice
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 120-ounce can crushed pineapple
2 teaspoons freshly grated orange zest.

steps.headline: Add the water and sugar to the saucepan.
steps.description: Cook over medium high heat at a simmer, stirring regularly until the sugar dissolves.

steps.headline: Add the pineapple and juice to a food processor.
steps.description: Puree the pineapple and the juice until smooth.

steps.headline: Transfer the pureed contents to a metal bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar syrup, lemon juice, orange juice and the orange zest.

steps.headline: Place the bowl in the freezer.
steps.description: Allow to freeze until if firms a little but does not freeze solid.

steps.headline: Remove from the freezer.
steps.description: Place the sorbet ingredients through the food processor another time. Process until it forms a smooth mixture.

steps.headline: Transfer the sorbet mixture into a suitable freezing container.
steps.description: Return to the freezer and allow to freeze properly. This will take about 2 hours.

steps.headline: Place scoops of the sorbet into dishes or dessert cups for serving.

text:
Simple mango and pineapple sorbet Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
2 cups frozen mango chunks
1/2 cup pineapple juice. Place the frozen mango chunks into the blender. Add the pineapple juice. Blend to combine. If the sorbet is too runny, add more mango; if too thick, add more juice. If there is too much mango or juice eliminate some. Place scoops straight into the serving dishes or ice cream cups.  Mango and pineapple sorbet in a Wildside jar Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
1 orange, peeled and cut in half
1 cup pineapple chunks
2 tablespoons sugar syrup or agave nectar
1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lime juice
2 cups ripe mango chunks. Place the ingredients into a Wildside jar. Add them in the order above. Secure the lid. Select the ice cream setting. When ready, serve. Mango and pineapple sorbet in a Vitamix Gather the ingredients. You'll need:
1 cup frozen pineapple chunks
1 cup frozen mango chunks
1/2 cup unsweetened vanilla almond milk or dairy milk with a drop of vanilla extract. Add all of the ingredients to the Vitamix.  Blend the ingredients together until smooth.  Scoop into dishes or dessert cups for serving. Sprinkle a little desiccated coconut on top for a garnish (optional). Mango and pineapple sorbet Gather your ingredients. You'll need:
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup granulated sugar
2 cups orange juice
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 120-ounce can crushed pineapple
2 teaspoons freshly grated orange zest. Add the water and sugar to the saucepan. Cook over medium high heat at a simmer, stirring regularly until the sugar dissolves. Add the pineapple and juice to a food processor. Puree the pineapple and the juice until smooth. Transfer the pureed contents to a metal bowl. Add the sugar syrup, lemon juice, orange juice and the orange zest. Place the bowl in the freezer. Allow to freeze until if firms a little but does not freeze solid. Remove from the freezer. Place the sorbet ingredients through the food processor another time. Process until it forms a smooth mixture. Transfer the sorbet mixture into a suitable freezing container. Return to the freezer and allow to freeze properly. This will take about 2 hours. Place scoops of the sorbet into dishes or dessert cups for serving.
